name: Beaumont Hotel & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: This was our first stay at the Beaumont and I hope not our last. We stayed in room 304 and everything about the room and the stay was delightful. The staff is all so friendly and welcoming. We also enjoyed dinner and lunch the next day at the Ore Restuarant which is part of this historic property. We have done a lot of traveling and by far this is one of the best hotels we have stayed at. The value is terrific too and we thought very reasonably priced. I wish we did not live so far away! F. Berry Dallas TX.
reviews.title: What a wonderful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our third stay in the historic Beaumont Hotel in Ouray and we thoroughly enjoyed it. The hotel was acquired by new owners a year or two ago and they have continued the tradition of excellence that has been the standard at the Beaumont since it was restored 12-13 years ago. Ouray is a favorite destination and we don't consider any other accommodations. We do miss the full breakfast on the veranda, but we understand the difficulties in operating a full breakfast restaurant in a very seasonal location. The continental breakfast is good; we ate at the hotel three mornings and one morning took a short walk to one of the excellent local bistros. The hotel restaurant is excellent--Ouray has a few top-notch restaurants, but our meal at the Ore House at the hotel was the best we had on this trip. Service is friendly and efficient, beds are excellent and the hotel is kept spotless. It is very well maintained. It is very quiet; as a couple in our mid-60s we appreciated the policy of not allowing children in the hotel--it would not be a kid-friendly environment in any event. If we have an opportunity to bring our grandchildren to Ouray one of these days, we will just have to find another place to stay, Overall, this is one of my favorite hotels anywhere and we highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Excellent choice in Ouray

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I know, most people like to stay in a hotel with hot springs when in Ouray. But you pay the price: accommodations are often substandard and overpriced, we've tried them several times. This time, a chance encounter in the Visitor's center led us to the Beaumont, a hotel originally built at the height of the Gold Boom, in 1986. I've often admired its imposing architecture on Main St, but avoided staying there, having had my taste of old hotels in bad shape. The tourist office lady, a local, told me that the hotel was closed for 40 years: the owner in the early 60's had a fight with the city about parking space, and when she did not get it her way, she closed the hotel, boarded the windows with plywood and painted the whole thing pink! Plus, she stopped paying taxes. For the next 40 years, while unpaid taxes accumulated (a deterrent to any potential buyer), the property went from bad to worse, an eyesore right in the middle of Main St. Until a couple ran into it and liked it so much, they bought and renovated it. They got married in the hotel and are now living in what was once known as the "Presidential Suite", because Teddy Roosevelt stayed in it once upon a time.
reviews.title: Beautiful Beaumont in Ouray

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Beaumont now features all its ancient beauty, with multitude of Victorian details and restored original furniture, as well as all modern comforts, including a spa. Each of the rooms is uniquely furnished and a gem. While the Presidential Suite is no longer available to visitors, there is no shortage of beautiful rooms in the gorgeous luxury boutique hotel which is still suprisingly affordable. It had a great bar and the continental breakfast offered fresh fruit and eggs and yogurt and pastries. The well stocked bar was also very pleasant to look at. We made one mistake: we ate across the street, in the Outlaw, an old hangout of ours, which has gone substantially down since we last saw it. Next time, we will try the ORE, the Beaumont restaurant and grill. Service in the hotel was attentive and friendly, Direct TV was in all rooms and we had an absolutely marvelous time. Cannot wait to go back!
reviews.title: An historic treasure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At the suggestion of the visitor center we stayed in the Beaumont. A very fortunate decision it was. The hotel dates from the 1800's gold and silver booom and was, indeed, a gem. The room we had was on the third floor but there is an elevator and it was worth the climb if you chose. It was a very large room with a great bath (double sinks), comfortable bed and several other amenities. At one side of the very large lobby was the breakfast area. The breakfast was not much to speak of but, there was a bar area and through the side door you could step out onto a courtyard where lunch was served. The town is known as the Switzerland of America. Parking is available on the South side of the building.
reviews.title: Victorian Get-away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As you open the front door and walk down the corridor to the light-filled lobby, you feel you have stepped back to the era of gold and silver mining barons. On the National Register of Historic Places, the Beaumont opened in 1887. Walking up the 125-year-old oak staircase to your room you can envision the many people who have walked up these stairs before. The hotel was closed for many years, but renovations were begun in 1999, and now the hotel offers an elegant retreat. We stayed in the Hoover Room, an absolute delight--southern views, stained glass window in the bathroom, charming lamps--every detail was perfect. A continental breakfast was served in Bulow's Bistro, a cozy space which was the hotel's original bar...with the 125 year-old wood floor and brick walls. I'd suggest having the truffles awaiting for your arrival---decadent treat!
reviews.title: An elegant experience from an earlier time......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We attended a wedding held at the Beaumont and were instantly charmed the moment we walked in the door. We adore the attention to detail that brought this historic beauty back to life. I must say that it was one of the best places we've ever stayed. Plus, the staff is so very helpful. They all seem to sincerely love the place and want it to be the best it can be. The location is very convenient. You can spend lots of relaxing time walking the main street of Ouray and the central location of Ouray makes it easy enough to have little day trips to Silverton or Telluride. We really enjoyed the town of Ouray and can't wait to go back. We went hiking to see the waterfalls in the day and had good food at night. What a great natural way to get a good night's sleep.
reviews.title: Spectacular!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We came to Ouray for a wedding in May and stayed in the Bluebird room. This was such an amazing hotel. The staff were amazing and so accomodating. I loved the character of the hotel. All the details of the place and the rooms were incredible. I even liked that they still have keys instead of key cards! The bar and food were great, too. We can't wait to go back and will definitely go there again. Highly recommend to anyone traveling to that area if you want the full effect of staying in Ouray and feel the history.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were on our honeymoon and everyone at the Beaumont made us feel like royalty. We stayed in the Dragonfly Suite which was absolutly beautiful. We were taken to our room at the time of check-in. This was just the begining of how wonderful and helpful everyone was at there. We could not have asked for a more wonderful honeymoon. Any information that we asked about was either give or looked up for us. It was nice to feel like we were important to the staff. The history of the Beaumont was so nice to see and be told about, we got to have a tour of the ballroom. Brian told us a wonderful story about the ballroom that was just perfect for the romatic get away we were on. Thank you to everyone that helped us with our wonderful stay.
reviews.title: Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location and facilities are beautiful. The staff are friendly. The rooms are nice. The only negatives are the room A/C does not seem very effective in keeping the rooms cool, and the continental breakfast is minimal in both quantity and quality.
reviews.title: Warm in the Cool Mountains

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were in Ouray for a wedding and stayed at the Beaumont Hotel. The Beaumont is a lovely hotel. I was pleased with the cleanliness of the room and bathroom. It is grand, yet feels quaint and friendly at the same time. I gave four out of five stars only because the breakfast wasn't anything special.
reviews.title: Wonderful Weekend at the Beaumont

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The price is right for the scenery and the hotel. While it's true they could improve on the breakfast - it's fair and we appreciated it. We stayed in the Dragonfly suite, which has original period furniture from the 1800's and is wonderfully decorated. No counter space in the bathroom, but we managed. Ask the staff for anything and they will accommodate. This was one of 4 luxury hotels we stayed in during our 2 weeks in Colorado and well worth it. Our stay in Durango afterwards truly proved that our stay at the Beaumont was better! The bookstore is awesome - very eclectic for its size. Great food and drink @ O'Briens in town. Overall the Beaumont had a comfy, large bed, large flat screen TV and the friendly staff made it a plus. You won't go wrong here.
reviews.title: Beautiful setting, friendly staff, gorgeosly restored.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 5 nights at The Beaumont last week. Since we first saw the hotel, back when it was boarded up and pink, we have wanted to stay there. There is nothing bad about the hotel, but there were random things that just kept the stay from being worth the price we paid. Some mornings room service made the bed, others they just pulled the spread up, white pillows left on top of the spread. One day, they didn't leave coffee for the coffee maker in the room. Another morning there was not coffee in the third floor lobby. The bathrooms do not seem to be well equipped (we were in one of the two most expensive suites), there is no real counter space, there were no extra towels, you had two rather small towels each day which seemed inadequate and hardly what I would expect in what is billed as a luxury hotel. In retrospect we should have spent one night there, just to see the hotel, and then moved on. I guess I was expecting more from this hotel.
reviews.title: Maybe our stay was too long

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel tops my lifelong list of hotels visited, worldwide. If you are lucky enough to travel to this beautiful part of the country, you owe it to yourself to stay at least one night at the Beaumont. My husband and I stayed here on our Western Slope anniversary road trip from Denver. As beautiful as this place is, the staff are what make this hotel. We received such great service and were pleasantly surprised with the complimentary breakfast in the great bar/restaurant, as well as coffee set up on the third floor to sip while we got ready for breakfast. :)
reviews.title: A world class hotel minus the stuffy attitude

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Be sure to take the free tour for guests at 2:30 to hear all about the history of this place- it is deep. Leave it up to a Texas A&M inventor (Go Aggies!) to put $24 million in restoring a piece of CO history. My husband and I stayed in the Bluebird room, 301- the only room in the building with original flooring. I was IN LOVE.
reviews.title: Great place to celebrate our anniversary!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012
reviews.text: We stayed one night in June. The hotel looks great and beautiful! After reading the positive reviews we were curious. Everything looks great and the staff acts very friendly. But in my opinion it did not feel welcoming and really warm. There are a lot of restrictions because of the historic place. For example wipe your feet, don't use the stairs with your suitcase, do not lie on the bed with the drapes on it, don't open the window, and so on. I really understand this. It is a beautiful hotel and you must take care of it and use it very carefully. This is not my critic, but the manner how they tell you all this is not pleasant! You feel like a schoolboy; don't do this and don't do that. Of course I will be careful in a hotel or any other place. Second point of critic is the breakfast. They warn you not to expect anything of it, but this was nothing; the coffee was cold, there was not enough and nobody of the staff was really in charge or felt responsible. If you don't want to spend any attention to it, why should you present the breakfast at all?! The checking out was a bit the same. No eye contact and no real interest in me as a paying client. So in short the hotel is beautiful, but the manners and making you feel welcome can improve a lot!!
reviews.title: Great historic hotel, but something was missing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed here before and it is still a great place. Last time we were there we had the tower suite which was very nice, this time however we got just a regular room. They are still nice but not exactly worth the price. The beds are very short. Im over six feet tall and I had to sleep at an angle to fit. Also there are windows in the bathroom that open out into the hall. I know that the place is very old and it is a historic hotel but it just seems like they could update it a litle. Also one thing that we really didnt like was the breakfast. I know you shouldnt expect much from a free breakfast, but getting spoiled orange juice is just unacceptable.
reviews.title: quaint

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here three nights, and quite enjoyed it. The restoration of the hotel is very well done, and you feel like you are stepping back in history in the rooms. The several staff members we dealt with were all very friendly and helpful. The room was comfortable and clean.
reviews.title: Nice historic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Two additional comments: I am not rating it 5 stars because I intentionally paid for a "suite" and got -- a single room. We stayed in the King Leopold "Suite" and it is a single room smaller than most hotel rooms. I really don't know how they justify calling it a suite.
reviews.title: Absolutely First Class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also, stay here if you love the historic aspect of it, but know you are not staying at a hotel with all the latest amenities you would find in a modern luxury hotel. There is no coffee service in the room, no ironing board, you have to call the front desk for ice, etc.
reviews.title: Perfect!

description: Built in 1886 at the height of the “Gold Boom,” this lovely old hotel is still known as the 'Flagship of the San Juans." Graciously appointed with sumptuous amenities, the boutique hotel has welcomed such famous guests as U.S. Presidents Theodore Roosevelt and Herbert Hoover, King Leopold of Belgium, Chipeta (widow of Ute Chief Ouray), French actress Sarah Bernhardt, American actress Angie Dickenson and (most recently) media megastar, Oprah Winfrey. Recent restorations modernized the entire structure to meet the needs and cares of today's traveler while preserving the property's historical grandeur.The historic Beaumont Hotel & Spa is the only luxury hotel in Ouray, Colorado. The setting is unique, the experience unforgettable. Guests are treated to modern amenities, including wireless high-speed internet, and outstanding personalized service paired with timeless old world ambience. Elegant, authentic decor, exquisite antiques, and custom-made furnishings combined with on-site dining, shopping, a luxurious spa and concierge services make this award-winning boutique hotel a delightful destination.Twelve elegantly furnished luxury rooms and suites, each uniquely furnished and decorated with reproductions and restorations of original hotel antiques. The hotel provides an elevator and reserved (heated) off-street parking for guests.
